column2: best known for playing fagin in the 1968 film ""oliver!"" has died aged 91. his agent said moody
column3: who received an oscar nomination for best actor for his performance in the charles dickens adaptation
column4: died in the hospital thursday. the actor was born ronald moodnick in london
column5: the son of jewish immigrants. he studied at the london school of economics and did not start acting until his university years. moody played fagin in the stage version of the musical ""oliver!"" in the west end and on broadway before starring in the film. he continued to have a long career in tv and film
column6: including a role in the long-running soap opera east. enders. he is survived by his widow and six children. copyright 2015 the associated press. all rights reserved. this material may not be published
